metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8786 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
pcre2test.c in PCRE2 10.23 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted regular expression.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8786` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcre2-16-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-32-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-8-0 - 10.31-2
libpcre2-posix0 - 10.31-2
pcre2-utils - 10.31-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> issue is in pcre2test, which is a test program

criterions.comment: pcre2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.31-2').
